DataElement.preferredDefinition: Term to define the extent of seizure activity in an individual.

Property.preferredDefinition: A statement or an account describing something.

PermissibleValues.value: Partial Seizure with Secondary Generalized Seizures
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Partial Seizure with Secondary Generalized Seizures

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Partial Seizure with Secondary Generalized Seizures
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Partial Seizure with Secondary Generalized Seizures
Hard, involved or complicated, elaborate, having many parts.: Partial seizure.

Concepts.definition: Hard, involved or complicated, elaborate, having many parts.

A transitory alteration in movement, sensation or autonomic nerve function due to abnormal electric activity in a localized area of the cerebral cortex, usually without change in awareness or alertness. Symptoms vary with different lesion locations and may include but not limited to the motor (e.g. rhythmic muscle contractions in one area of the body), somatosensory and sensory alterations manifested by abnormal numbness, paresthesias or other hallucinations, including several types of aura; autonomic and psychic symptoms, e.g. with changes in speech, thought, personality, mood, sensation of deja vu or hallucinations.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Easy, not involved or complicated, not elaborate, having few parts.: Partial seizure.

Concepts.definition: Easy, not involved or complicated, not elaborate, having few parts.

A transitory alteration in movement, sensation or autonomic nerve function due to abnormal electric activity in a localized area of the cerebral cortex, usually without change in awareness or alertness. Symptoms vary with different lesion locations and may include but not limited to the motor (e.g. rhythmic muscle contractions in one area of the body), somatosensory and sensory alterations manifested by abnormal numbness, paresthesias or other hallucinations, including several types of aura; autonomic and psychic symptoms, e.g. with changes in speech, thought, personality, mood, sensation of deja vu or hallucinations.
